bibl.title: Letter from Chauncey B. Baker to Albert E. Truby, April 3, 1935

div1.p: Baker writes that he is sending Truby a copy of his yellow fever experiences.

div1.head: Letter from Chauncey B. Baker to Albert E. Truby, April 3, 1935
div1.opener:
THE AMERICAN NATIONAL
FIRE INSURANCE COMPANY
COLUMBUS, OHIO
HOME OFFICE
50 WEST BROAD ST., COLUMBUS, OHIO
April 3, 1935
DANIEL
VICE-PRESIDENT
JOSEPH G.
ASSISTANT
FROM GEN. ALBERT E. TRUBY
General Truby
Walter Reed Memorial Hospital
Washington, D.C.
My dear General:
div1.p:
I am enclosing herewith a copy of the recital
of my experiences in Havana with the Yellow Fever situ-
ation at the period of our occupation. I want to thank
you again for your kindness in going over the manuscript
and I am sure that you will be interested in rereading
it.

I wish to say that I am continuing in satisfactory
shape, thanks to my experience at Walter Reed. There have
been no new developments that would interest you, but I
am constantly on the alert for anything that may offer.
